channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A fire in an Swiss ski resort bar has left about 40 people dead
item.description: A New Year's party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, many in thei...

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali daycare owners, DOJ's initial release of Epstein files left many questions unanswered,...

item.title: With few Epstein files released, conspiracy theories flourish and questions remain
item.description: President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted th...

item.title: Brain organoids are helping researchers, but their use also creates unease
item.description: Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits...

item.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned
item.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monro...

item.title: Trump says if Iran kills protesters, U.S. will "come to their rescue"
item.description: As U.S.-Iran tension soars, Trump warns violence against protesters could bring an American intervention: "We are locked and loaded and ready to go."

item.title: Dozens missing after boat carrying 200 migrants sinks off Gambia
item.description: It is the latest accident on one of the worldâ€™s most dangerous routes used by West Africans trying to reach Spain.

item.title: Woman killed in suspected mountain lion attack in Colorado
item.description: A woman was killed in what appears to be the first fatal mountain lion attack in Colorado in nearly 30 years.

item.title: Maduro says Venezuela open to US talks on drug trafficking
item.description: In an interview with state TV, the Venezuelan president also evaded a question about an attack in his country claimed by the US.

item.title: Indian families grieve deaths caused by contaminated tap water
item.description: Officials in Indore say four people have died after drinking contaminated water but families allege the toll is higher.

item.title: 9/29: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump, Netanyahu outline peace plan to end the war in Gaza; Far-right influencers express outrage over Super Bowl halftime performer Bad Bunny.

item.description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers are at odds as the federal government is set to shut down without congressional action; How a government shutdown ...

item.title: Trump says he takes higher daily dose of aspirin than doctors recommend
item.description: In an interview about his health, the US president says: "I don't want thick blood pouring through my heart".

item.title: 1/1: CBS Evening News
item.description: At least 40 killed, 115 injured in celebration in Switzerland; millions facing increases in health care bills

item.title: Watch: Four men rescued from boat teetering on dam edge
item.description: According to reports, the boat had suffered motor failure before drifting to the edge of the dam

item.title: Rain soaks Rose Parade in California and snow squalls hit Midwest and Northeast on first day of 2026

item.title: Trump, in interview, defends his energy and health, offers new details on screening he underwent
Health subsidies expire, launching millions of Americans into 2026 with steep insurance hikes
